abstract: Patrick J Lynch is re-elected as president of New York City Patrolmen's Benevolent Assn after defeating opponents Brian Fusco and Ronald Wilson, who were first to challenge Lynch in decade; victory comes months after engaging in public battle with Mayor Bill de Blasio over protests against death of Eric Garner.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Lynch overcame two opponents, his first challengers in a decade, by taking 70 percent of the vote to lead the New York City Patrolmen’s Benevolent Association.

headline.main: Patrick Lynch, Police Union Chief Who Fought de Blasio, Wins a 5th Term
headline.print_headline: Police Union Chief Who Fought Mayor Wins Fifth Term With 70% of the Vote

snippet: Mr. Lynch overcame two opponents, his first challengers in a decade, by taking 70 percent of the vote to lead the New York City Patrolmen’s Benevolent Association.

keywords.value: Wilson, Ronald (New York, NY, Police Officer)
